rows.text_1_facilitator: But what if children are already misbehaving? Can you still redirect their behaviour at that point?

text_1_facilitator.eng: But what if children are already misbehaving? Can you still redirect their behaviour at that point?

quiz_1_question.eng: True or False: You can use redirect at any time, even when your child is already behaving badly like having a tantrum.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
âŒ Incorrect.

rows.text_1_facilitator: 4ï¸âƒ£ There are four steps to redirecting behaviour: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.

text_1_facilitator.eng: 4ï¸âƒ£ There are four steps to redirecting behaviour: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.

section_1_text.eng:
âœ… Take a few breaths before asking your child to do something else.
âœ… Speak with a calm voice.

section_2_text.eng:
2ï¸âƒ£ BE QUICK

â° Ask your child to do something else, distract them, before the behaviour begins or gets worse.
ğŸ’¡ This is much easier than using consequences after they do something!

section_3_text.eng:
âœ… Rather than saying what you DONâ€™T like or want, tell your child what you DO want them to do.
For example, say:

This way, it is easier for them to follow! â­

section_4_text.eng:
ğŸ’š Use positive words. Say â€œCome and help me plant these vegetables,â€ instead of saying, â€œStop fighting.â€
â­ Praise your child when they behave well!
ğŸ’™ It will also help them know what you expect from them!
